channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped vehicle, 9th July
item.description:
Dumped vehicle advertising... hasn't moved for over a year, please get rid of it and introduce restrictions asap, so these heaps can be removed quickly and owners fined

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erindale, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road is not cleaned or swept often enough and there is always litter and leaves on the pavement, 9th July
item.description:
The road has not been cleaned or swept for a long while. There is litter and leaves/rubbish everywhere and it needs to be addressed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchfields Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: Prolific tagger, 9th July
item.description:
A prolific tagger locally has criminally damaged this bus stop as with many other bus stops and BT cabinets in the area. Needs police action

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Outside 16 Carlisle road nw6 6ts, 9th July
item.description:
The tree roots which I’ve complained about multiple times is now even worse and causing significant damage to the pavement and the outside of my house despite being cut back and despite promises that it will be dealt with

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Carlisle Road, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti getting worse, 9th July
item.description:
Graffiti is getting worse here due to inaction, 2 large tags added on consecutive days. All linked to numerous examples locally bus stops and BT cabinets.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erindale, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches in the path of pedestrians and cars, 9th July
item.description:
This tree outside 135 has low hanging branches that hit your face as you walk under it. There’s been branches knocked into the road by passing Lorries too. Also the conker tree outside 141/143 is low over the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Infront of Gardener House -Redhill Street, 9th July
item.description:
Frail or disabled pedestrian likely to cross ahead triangle warning sign to alert drivers is fixed in the wrong way round hence the drivers can not see as they approach the road. This is the case on Albany street too! Please advise the appropriate department to train their staff on how these signs should be facing the drivers and not sideways for pedestrians as per the Highway Code.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redhill Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins in pocket park next to doctors surgery on Theydon Road., 9th July
item.description:
The 4 bins in the pocket park on Theydon Road Clapton E5 9BQ are overflowing. These are next to the doctors surgery. We have informed Valley Provincial who were the company who emptied the bins but have had no response.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tudor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins and fly tipping, 9th July
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sigdon Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Hole On Pavement, 9th July
